00006 package WeBWorK::PG::IO::WW1;
00007 use base qw(Exporter);

00009 =head1 NAME
00010 
00011 WeBWorK::PG::IO::WW1 - Private functions used by WeBWorK::PG::Translator for
00012 file IO under WeBWorK 1.x.
00013 
00014 =cut
00015 
00016 use strict;
00017 use warnings;
00018 use Net::SMTP;
00019 
00020 BEGIN {
00021     our @EXPORT = qw(
00022         send_mail_to
00023         surePathToTmpFile
00024     );
00025     
00026     $WeBWorK::PG::IO::SHARE{$_} = __PACKAGE__ foreach @EXPORT;
00027 }

00029 =head1 FUNCTIONS
00030 
00031 =over
00032 
00033 =item send_mail_to($user_address,'subject'=>$subject,'body'=>$body)
00034 
00035 Returns true if the address is ok, otherwise a fatal error is signaled using
00036 die.
00037 
00038 Sends $body to the address specified by $user_address provided that the address
00039 appears in C<@{$Global::PG_environment{'ALLOW_MAIL_TO'}}>.
00040 
00041 This subroutine is likely to be fragile and to require tweaking when installed
00042 in a new environment. It uses the C<Net::SMTP> module.
00043 
00044 =cut
00045 
00046 sub send_mail_to {
00047     my $user_address = shift;   # user must be an instructor
00048     my %options = @_;
00049     
00050     my $subject = '';
00051     $subject = $options{'subject'} if defined($options{'subject'});
00052     
00053     my $msg_body = '';
00054     $msg_body =$options{'body'} if defined($options{'body'});
00055     
00056     my @mail_to_allowed_list = ();
00057     @mail_to_allowed_list = @{ $options{'ALLOW_MAIL_TO'} } if defined($options{'ALLOW_MAIL_TO'});
00058     my $out;
00059     
00060     # check whether user is an instructor
00061     my $mailing_allowed_flag = 0;
00062     
00063     while (@mail_to_allowed_list) {
00064         if ($user_address eq shift @mail_to_allowed_list ) {
00065             $mailing_allowed_flag =1;
00066             last;
00067         }
00068     }
00069     
00070     my $REMOTE_HOST = (defined( $ENV{'REMOTE_HOST'} ) ) ? $ENV{'REMOTE_HOST'}: 'unknown host';
00071     my $REMOTE_ADDR = (defined( $ENV{'REMOTE_ADDR'}) ) ? $ENV{'REMOTE_ADDR'}: 'unknown address';
00072     
00073     if ($mailing_allowed_flag) {
00074         ## mail header text:
00075         my $email_msg ="To:  $user_address\n"
00076             . "X-Remote-Host:  $REMOTE_HOST($REMOTE_ADDR)\n"
00077             . "Subject: $subject\n\n"
00078             . $msg_body;
00079         my $smtp = Net::SMTP->new($Global::smtpServer, Timeout=>10)
00080             or warn "Couldn't contact SMTP server.";
00081         $smtp->mail($Global::webmaster);
00082         
00083         if ( $smtp->recipient($user_address)) {  # this one's okay, keep going
00084             $smtp->data( $email_msg)
00085                 or warn("Unknown problem sending message data to SMTP server.");
00086         } else {            # we have a problem a problem with this address
00087             $smtp->reset;
00088             warn "SMTP server doesn't like this address: <$user_address>.";
00089         }
00090         $smtp->quit;
00091     } else {
00092         die "There has been an error in creating this problem.\n"
00093             . "Please notify your instructor.\n\n"
00094             . "Mail is not permitted to address $user_address.\n"
00095             . "Permitted addresses are specified in the courseWeBWorK.ph file.";
00096         $out = 0;
00097     }
00098     
00099     return $out;
00100 }
00101 
00102 =item surePathToTmpFile($path)
00103 
00104 Calls C<&main::surePathToTmpFile>.
00105 
00106 =cut
00107 
00108 sub surePathToTmpFile {
00109     return main::surePathToTmpFile();
00110 }
00111 
00112 =back
